intro: Dampiera sacculata, commonly known as the yellow daisy or sand daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Dampiera sacculata is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
